channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘It’s an absolute bloodbath’: Washington Post undergoing significant layoffs as part of ‘strategic reset’
item.description: Former Post executive editor blasts owner Jeff Bezos’s ‘sickening efforts to curry favor’ with Trump The Washington Post laid off hundreds of employee...

item.title: Israeli strikes kill 21 in Gaza and patient crossings at Rafah halted, Palestinian officials say
item.description: Four children among dead as restrictions on evacuations put in place days after reopening of crossing to Egypt Israeli tank shelling and airstrikes ha...

item.title: White House border czar says 700 federal agents will leave Minnesota
item.description: Departure marks large drop in agents on the ground but still leaves about 2,000 there, far above typical levels for state US politics live – latest up...

item.title: Nigel Farage made ‘non-apology’, says school contemporary who accused him of racism
item.description: Film-maker Peter Ettedgui responded to BBC interview in which Reform leader apologised for any hurt caused Nigel Farage has been accused of making a “...

item.title: Trump’s border czar says administration will immediately withdraw 700 immigration enforcement officers from Minnesota – live
item.description: Tom Homan says ‘around 2000’ immigration officers will remain in Minnesota and that pre-operation the number was between 100 and 150 officers Tennesse...

item.title: Summer camp sex offender admits drugging wife
item.description: Jon Ruben was arrested after eight children and one adult fell ill at Stathern Lodge in Leicestershire.

item.title: Henry Zeffman: Dark mood among Labour MPs as PM tries to contain Mandelson scandal
item.description: The chaos of the parliamentary debate about the former Labour minister is just one sign of how quickly the mood in the party has soured this week.

item.title: Severe rail disruption continues after derailment in south-east London
item.description: Southern, Thameslink and Gatwick Express rail routes are severely disrupted after a derailment.

item.title: Tesco apologises after placing Welsh language signs in Cornish branch
item.description: One councillor hopes this is an opportunity for supermarkets to support Cornish more directly.

item.title: Son of Norway's crown princess holds back tears giving evidence at rape trial
item.description: Marius Borg Høiby gives evidence after the first woman he is alleged to have raped told the court she believed she had been drugged.
